intro: Leucanthemum vulgare subsp. maximum, commonly known as the Shasta daisy, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It features showy white ray florets surrounded by yellow disk flowers, giving it a daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped, hairy leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in meadows and open woodlands. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
